intro: Bulbillaria, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and dense foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Bulbillaria thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
